Detailed Description

UdpSocket exposes interfaces to send/receive UDP datagrams.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN UdpSocket::HandOver (  UdpSocket &  to_socket  )  [inline]
 

Hands over itself to to_socket. This socket is then reverted to closed state and hence does not operate any more. Instead, to_socket continues operation. This method should only be used to hand over a socket between execution contexts if needed. Note that if you hand over a socket from one execution context to another, also the execution context to which to_socket belongs must have initialized a socket handler. For the hand over to succeed this socket must be in open state and to_socket must be in closed state. If the hand over can not be performed FALSE is returned.

See also:
ExecutionContext

SocketHandler

Returns:
Success of hand over.

void UdpSocket::OnControlMsg (  const SocketControlMsg &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Translates the socket control message msg into a socket event and routes it accordingly. If a listener is set, its OnSocketEvent method is called. Otherwise the messages are discarded.

Implements InetSocket.

BOOLEAN UdpSocket::Open (  const InetSocketAddr *  local_addr = 0,
BOOLEAN  may_reuse_addr = TRUE
) 
 

Open UDP type socket.

Parameters:
local_addr local address to bind socket to
may_reuse_addr local address may be bound by multiple sockets

INT UdpSocket::Read (  void *  buf,
INT  buflen,
InetSocketAddr *  from = 0
)  [inline]
 

Reads data from the socket. The from parameter may be specified for retrieving the source address.

Returns:
Number of bytes read or -1 on failure.

Reimplemented from InetSocket.

Reimplemented in UdpNetAdapter.

BOOLEAN UdpSocket::SetPeer (  const InetSocketAddr &  addr  ) 
 

Sets the default address of peer. Write requests without receiver address will be sent to this default address. Note: Any datagrams received from an address other than the destination address specified will be discarded.

INT UdpSocket::Write (  const void *  buf,
INT  buflen,
const InetSocketAddr *  to = 0
)  [inline]
 

Writes data to the socket. The to parameter may specify a destination address. If it is not specified, then the data is sent to the sockets default destination address previously established via SetPeer().

Returns:
Number of bytes written or -1 on failure.

Reimplemented from InetSocket.
